channel.title: Just a quick question :)
channel.description:
well i havent even touched scar since kait went down and now im just looking over things :D anyway this is my question, well its a kind of a how would i do this question :P so how would i write this in SCAR
if checkbox1 is ticked then.. do stuff :)
i basically want to know what code is used to check/see if a certain checkbox is ticked,anyone know how i can do this? help is appreciated,thanks[br][size=1]Posted at: July 17, 2006, 06:42:55 AM[/size][hr]anyone know please?

item.title: Just a quick question :)
item.dc:creator: @wixter wixter
item.description:
@wixter wrote:

[quote=“Cheesehunk, post:10, topic:5180”]TerminateScript;

if not(ThisisTrue) then TerminateScript;

That will kill the script.[/quote]
thanks

Read full topic

item.title: Just a quick question :)
item.dc:creator: @Cheesehunk Cheesehunk
item.description:
@Cheesehunk wrote:

TerminateScript;

if not(ThisisTrue) then TerminateScript;

That will kill the script.

Read full topic

item.title: Just a quick question :)
item.dc:creator: @wixter wixter
item.description:
@wixter wrote:

just another quickquestion is there a piece of code which will terminate my script? like

if(blahblahaha) then killscript; or something? i always thought it was killscript; but it doesnt seem to work :o can anyone help?

Read full topic

item.title: Just a quick question :)
item.dc:creator: @Sub_Zero Sumilion
item.description:
@Sub_Zero wrote:

Lol, nice way of telling it was unchecked

Read full topic

item.title: Just a quick question :)
item.dc:creator: @wixter wixter
item.description:
@wixter wrote:

Sub Zero:

well… first of all, := is a decleration (correct me if thats the wrong name :P), so it would be if (Checkbox1 = true) then, cause = is to see if they are equal, then second of all, i always use If (CheckBox1) then, because then scar would see it as If (true) then (if it is checked) and then it will perform it anyway, so the = true part can be deleted, but yes, i think thats how they work…

thanks for your help, iv found it out now a friend help’d me a little heres what i have

procedure check|sender : toobject); begin if(checkbox1.state = cbchecked) then writeln('checked :P'); else if (checkbox1.state = cbunchecked) then writeln('noob!') end.

Read full topic

item.title: Just a quick question :)
item.dc:creator: @Sub_Zero Sumilion
item.description:
@Sub_Zero wrote:

well… first of all, := is a decleration (correct me if thats the wrong name :P), so it would be if (Checkbox1 = true) then, cause = is to see if they are equal, then second of all, i always use If (CheckBox1) then, because then scar would see it as If (true) then (if it is checked) and then it will perform it anyway, so the = true part can be deleted, but yes, i think thats how they work…

Read full topic

item.title: Just a quick question :)
item.dc:creator: @wixter wixter
item.description:
@wixter wrote:

[quote=“Sub Zero, post:4, topic:5180”]well… i’ve never worked with forms, but i believe that you should have something like :

Checkbox1 : Boolean; (this will be used in the form then)

That will be checked/ not checked by the user, and then Checkbox1 is true or false, so that would mean that if you have
If Checkbox1 then
Stuff;

and the user checked the box, then it will do Stuff;
Hope i’ve helped…[/quote]
hmm so maybe

if (checkbox1 := true);?

Read full topic

item.title: Just a quick question :)
item.dc:creator: @Sub_Zero Sumilion
item.description:
@Sub_Zero wrote:

well… i’ve never worked with forms, but i believe that you should have something like :

Checkbox1 : Boolean; (this will be used in the form then)

That will be checked/ not checked by the user, and then Checkbox1 is true or false, so that would mean that if you have
If Checkbox1 then
Stuff;

and the user checked the box, then it will do Stuff;
Hope i’ve helped…

Read full topic
